Module ca.utoronto.utm.assignment2
Package ca.utoronto.utm.assignment2.paint.shapes

Class Square

java.lang.Object
ca.utoronto.utm.assignment2.paint.shapes.Shape
ca.utoronto.utm.assignment2.paint.shapes.Polygon
ca.utoronto.utm.assignment2.paint.shapes.Square
public class Square extends Polygon
The Square class represents a square shape, a special case of a polygon. It extends the Polygon class and ensures that the shape always has 4 vertices, regardless of any changes made to the properties of the square. The square is defined by its start and end points and inherits paint properties from its parent class.

  • Constructor Details

    • Square

      public Square(Point start, Point end, PaintProperties pp)
      Constructor for creating a new square shape. This initializes the square with the given start and end points, and applies the paint properties. The number of vertices is set to 4, as squares have 4 vertices.
      Parameters:
      start - The starting point of the square.
      end - The ending point of the square.
      pp - The paint properties for the square.

  • Method Details

    • setProperties

      public void setProperties(PaintProperties properties)
      Overrides the setProperties method to ensure that the number of vertices for a square is always set to 4, even if the paint properties are updated. This ensures that any attempt to modify the number of vertices in a square does not affect its inherent 4-vertex structure.
      Overrides:
      setProperties in class Shape
      Parameters:
      properties - The paint properties to apply to the square.
